blocks.content: Extend class notation with the vertex degree function.

df-vtxdg
blocks.content: Define the vertex degree function for a graph. To be appropriate for arbitrary hypergraphs, we have to double-count those edges that contain ` u ` "twice" (i.e. self-loops), this being represented as a singleton as the edge's value. Since the degree of a vertex can be (positive) infinity (if the graph containing the vertex is not of finite size), the extended addition ` +e ` is used for the summation of the number of "ordinary" edges" and the number of "loops". (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 9-Dec-2020.)

axiom df-vtxdg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cvtxdg, cmpt(s0, universe, csb(s1, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), csb(s2, cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), cmpt(s3, cv(s1), co(cfv(chash, crab(s4, cdm(cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s3), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4))))), cxad, cfv(chash, crab(s4, cdm(cv(s2)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), csn(cv(s3)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
}

axiom df-vtxdg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ VtxDeg =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(Vtx ` s0)/ s1][(iEdg ` s0)/ s2](s3 ‚àà s1 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s4 ‚àà dom(s2)| s3 ‚àà(s2 ` s4)})[+](# ` { s4 ‚àà dom(s2)|(s2 ` s4)= { s3 } }))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
}

blocks.pretty:
thm vtxdgfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(VtxDeg ` c0)=(s0 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | s0 ‚àà(c4 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 |(c4 ` s1)= { s0 } }))))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(iEdg ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 = dom(c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  fvmptd2(hs0, cvtxdg, c0, (s0 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | s0 ‚àà(c4 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 |(c4 ` s1)= { s0 } }))), universe, [(Vtx ` hs0)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs0)/ hs2](s0 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)| s0 ‚àà(hs2 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)|(hs2 ` s1)= { s0 } }))), universe, c0 ‚àà c1)
  df-vtxdg(hs0, hs1, hs2, s0, s1)
  syl5eq([(Vtx ` hs0)/ hs1][(iEdg ` hs0)/ hs2](s0 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)| s0 ‚àà(hs2 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)|(hs2 ` s1)= { s0 } }))), (s0 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | s0 ‚àà(c4 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 |(c4 ` s1)= { s0 } }))), (s0 ‚àà(Vtx ` hs0)‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))| s0 ‚àà((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))|((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)= { s0 } }))), (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß hs0 = c0))
  csbie2(hs1, hs2, (Vtx ` hs0), (iEdg ` hs0), (s0 ‚àà hs1 ‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)| s0 ‚àà(hs2 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)|(hs2 ` s1)= { s0 } }))), (s0 ‚àà(Vtx ` hs0)‚Ü¶((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))| s0 ‚àà((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))|((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)= { s0 } }))))
  fvex(cvtx, hs0)
  fvex(ciedg, hs0)
  mpteq12dv(s0, hs1, ((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)| s0 ‚àà(hs2 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)|(hs2 ` s1)= { s0 } })), (Vtx ` hs0), ((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))| s0 ‚àà((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))|((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)= { s0 } })), (hs1 =(Vtx ` hs0)‚àß hs2 =(iEdg ` hs0)))
  simpl(hs1 =(Vtx ` hs0), hs2 =(iEdg ` hs0))
  adantl(hs1 =(Vtx ` hs0), hs2 =(iEdg ` hs0), ((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)| s0 ‚àà(hs2 ` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom(hs2)|(hs2 ` s1)= { s0 } }))=((# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))| s0 ‚àà((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)})[+](# ` { s1 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` hs0))|((iEdg ` hs0)` s1)= { s0 } })))

blocks.name: vtxdgelxnn0
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex is either a nonnegative integer or positive infinity. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 30-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 10-Dec-2020.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: vtxdg0v
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex in the null graph is zero (or anything else), because there are no vertices. (Contributed by AV, 11-Dec-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm vtxdg0v(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))

} = {
  imp(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))
  syl6bi(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0), wcel(c1, emptycls))
  syl5bb(wceq(c0, emptycls), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c1, emptycls), wcel(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0)))
  eleq2i(c1, c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eleq2d(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0), emptycls, wceq(c0, emptycls))
  syl6eq(cfv(cvtx, c0), emptycls, cfv(cvtx, emptycls), wceq(c0, emptycls))
  fveq2(c0, emptycls, cvtx)
  vtxval0()
  pm2.21i(wcel(c1, emptycls), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))
  noel(c1)
}

blocks.name: vtxdg0e
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex in an empty graph is zero, because there are no edges. This is the base case for the induction for calculating the degree of a vertex, for example in a Königsberg graph (see also the induction steps ~ vdegp1ai , ~ vdegp1bi and ~ vdegp1ci ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 20-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 11-Dec-2020.) (Revised by AV, 22-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm vtxdg0e(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, emptycls)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c0), nat0))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c3))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c0), nat0, co(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), wcel(c0, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c3), cv(hs0))))), caddc, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c3), cv(hs0)), csn(c0))))), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, emptycls)))
  syl2an2(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, emptycls), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c0), co(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), wcel(c0, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c3), cv(hs0))))), caddc, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c3), cv(hs0)), csn(c0)))))), wcel(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), cfn), wcel(c0, c1))
  sylbi(wceq(c2, emptycls), wcel(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), cfn), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c3), emptycls))
  syl6eqel(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), cfn, emptycls, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c3), emptycls))
  0fin()
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, emptycls))
  vtxdgfival(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c3)), c0, c1, c3, cfv(ciedg, c3))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c3))

blocks.name: vtxduhgr0e
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex in an empty hypergraph is zero, because there are no edges. Analogue of ~ vtxdg0e . (Contributed by AV, 15-Dec-2020.)

thm vtxduhgr0e(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  3impia(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(c3, emptycls), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))

  adantr(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2), wb(wceq(c3, emptycls), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wb(wceq(c3, emptycls), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls)), wfun(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  uhgrfun(c0, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  edg0iedg0(cfv(ciedg, c0), c3, c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2), wi(wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0)))
  ex(wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), emptycls), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))
  vtxdg0e(c1, c2, cfv(ciedg, c0), c0)
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
}

blocks.name: vtxdfiun
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex in the union of two hypergraphs of finite size on the same vertex set is the sum of the degrees of the vertex in each hypergraph. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Jan-2018.) (Revised by AV, 19-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm vtxdfiun(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), co(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c2), c1), caddc, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c1))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(ciedg, c2))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ciedg, c3))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cvtx, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c3), c6))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), c6))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cin(cdm(c4), cdm(c5)), emptycls))
  -| wi(w0, wfun(c4))
  -| wi(w0, wfun(c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), cun(c4, c5)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cdm(c4), cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(cdm(c5), cfn))
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), co(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c2), c1), caddc, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c1)), co(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c2), c1), cxad, cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c1)), w0)
  vtxdun(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, w0)
  rexaddd(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c2), c1), cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c1), w0)
  nn0red(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c2), c1), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c2), c1), cn0), wcel(cdm(c4), cfn), wcel(c1, c6))
  vtxdgfisnn0(cdm(c4), c1, c6, c2, c4)
  eqid(cdm(c4))
  nn0red(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c1), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c3), c1), cn0), wcel(cdm(c5), cfn), wcel(c1, cfv(cvtx, c3)))
  eleqtrrd(c1, cfv(cvtx, c3), c6, w0)

}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)})=(# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 }))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(Edg ` c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)})=(# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 })), d(s0, s1))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)})=(# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 })), d(s1, c0))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(# ` { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)})=(# ` { s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 })), d(s1, c2))
  hasheqf1od({ s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)}, { s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 }, universe, (hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)} ‚Ü¶((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)), (c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  a1i((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)} ‚àà ùïå)
  rabex(s0, dom((iEdg ` c0)), c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0))
  dmex((iEdg ` c0))
  fvex(ciedg, c0)
  ushgredgedg(s0, hs1, hs0, c0, c1, c2, (hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)} ‚Ü¶((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)), { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)}, { s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 }, c3, (iEdg ` c0))
  eqid((iEdg ` c0))
  eqid({ s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)})
  cbvrabv(s1, hs1, c3, c1 ‚àà s1, c1 ‚àà hs1)
  eleq2w(s1, hs1, c1)
  eqid((hs0 ‚àà { s0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` s0)} ‚Ü¶((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)))
  diff.cdm.s(s0, (iEdg ` c0))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, ciedg, c0)
  diff.ciedg.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c({ s1 ‚àà c3 | c1 ‚àà s1 })
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c((iEdg ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c((iEdg ` c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c1, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.w(c1 ‚àà s1)
}

thm vtxdushgrfvedg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  3eqtrd(cfv(c3, c1), co(cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), cxad, cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1))))), cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), co(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))), cxad, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))))), wa(wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c1, c2)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1)))
  fveq1i(c3, c1, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), co(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))), cxad, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1)))))))
  vtxdgval(hs0, c1, c2, c0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), cfv(ciedg, c0))

  oveq12d(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))), cxad, cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1)))), cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c1, c2)))
  vtxdushgrfvedglem(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c2, c4)
  hasheqf1od(crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))), crab(s0, c4, wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1))), universe, cmpt(hs1, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))), cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c1, c2)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))), universe))
  rabex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1)))
  dmex(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  fvex(ciedg, c0)
  ushgredgedgloop(hs0, hs2, hs1, c0, c1, c2, cmpt(hs1, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))), cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs1))), crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))), crab(s0, c4, wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1))), c4, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))))
  cbvrabv(s0, hs2, c4, wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1)), wceq(cv(hs2), csn(c1)))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), cv(hs2), csn(c1))
  eqid(cmpt(hs1, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), csn(c1))), cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs1))))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(crab(s0, c4, wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1))))
  diff.hs2.c(c4)

  diff.hs1.c(c0)

  diff.cv.s(s0, hs2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, c1)
  diff.hs2.w(wceq(cv(s0), csn(c1)))
}

  a1i((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), (c3 ` c1)=((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1))

  oveq12d((# ` { hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))| c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)}), cxad, (# ` { hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))|((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)= { c1 } }), (# ` { s0 ‚àà c4 | c1 ‚àà s0 }), (# ` { s0 ‚àà c4 | s0 = { c1 } }), (c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))

  a1i((c0 ‚àà USHGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), { hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))|((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)= { c1 } } ‚àà ùïå)
  rabex(hs0, dom((iEdg ` c0)), ((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)= { c1 })
  dmex((iEdg ` c0))
  fvex(ciedg, c0)
  ushgredgedgloop(hs0, hs2, hs1, c0, c1, c2, (hs1 ‚àà { hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))|((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)= { c1 } } ‚Ü¶((iEdg ` c0)` hs1)), { hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))|((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)= { c1 } }, { s0 ‚àà c4 | s0 = { c1 } }, c4, (iEdg ` c0))

  eqid((hs1 ‚àà { hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0))|((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)= { c1 } } ‚Ü¶((iEdg ` c0)` hs1)))

thm vtxdusgrfvedg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wcel(c1, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cedg, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  eqtrd(cfv(c3, c1), cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wcel(c1, cv(s0)))), cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))), wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2)))
  vtxdusgrval(hs0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  eqid(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  sylan(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))), cfv(chash, crab(s0, c4, wcel(c1, cv(s0))))), wcel(c0, cushgr))
  syl(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c0, cushgr), wcel(c0, cuspgr))
  usgruspgr(c0)
  uspgrushgr(c0)
  vtxdushgrfvedglem(hs0, s0, c0, c1, c2, c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(ciedg, c0))
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)

blocks.name: vtxduhgr0nedg
blocks.content: If a vertex in a hypergraph has degree 0, the vertex is not adjacent to another vertex via an edge. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 8-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 24-Dec-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm vtxduhgr0nedg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0)), wn(wrex(s0, c2, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cedg, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  3impia(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0), wn(wrex(s0, c2, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))))
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0), wn(wrex(s0, c2, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4))), wn(wrex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2), wb(wceq(cfv(c3, c1), nat0), wn(wrex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)))))))
  vtxd0nedgb(hs0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(ciedg, c0), c0)
  con3d(wa(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wrex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)))), wrex(s0, c2, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4)))
  rexlimdvw(s0, c2, wa(wcel(c0, cuhgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c4), wrex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)))))

blocks.name: 1loopgruspgr
blocks.content: A graph with one edge which is a loop is a simple pseudograph (see also ~ uspgr1v1eop ). (Contributed by AV, 21-Feb-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm 1loopgruspgr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cuspgr))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), csn(cop(c2, csn(c4)))))
} = {
  uspgr1e(c0, cfv(cvtx, c0), c2, c3, c4, c4, w0)
  eqid(cfv(cvtx, c0))
  eleqtrrd(c4, cfv(cvtx, c0), c1, w0)
  eqtrd(cfv(ciedg, c0), csn(cop(c2, cpr(c4, c4))), csn(cop(c2, csn(c4))), w0)
  sneqd(cop(c2, csn(c4)), cop(c2, cpr(c4, c4)), w0)
  opeq2d(c2, csn(c4), cpr(c4, c4), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(csn(c4), cpr(c4, c4)))
  dfsn2(c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm 1loopgruspgr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà USPGraph)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(Vtx ` c0)= c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c4 ‚àà c1)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí(iEdg ` c0)= { < c2, { c4 } > })
} = {
  uspgr1e(c0, (Vtx ` c0), c2, c3, c4, c4, w0)
  eqid((Vtx ` c0))
  eleqtrrd(c4, (Vtx ` c0), c1, w0)
  eqtrd((iEdg ` c0), { < c2, { c4, c4 } > }, { < c2, { c4 } > }, w0)
  sneqd(< c2, { c4 } >, < c2, { c4, c4 } >, w0)
  opeq2d(c2, { c4 }, { c4, c4 }, w0)
  a1i(w0, { c4 } = { c4, c4 })
  dfsn2(c4)
}

blocks.name: 1loopgredg
blocks.content: The set of edges in a graph (simple pseudograph) with one edge which is a loop is a singleton of a singleton. (Contributed by AV, 17-Dec-2020.) (Revised by AV, 21-Feb-2021.)

} = {

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(Edg ` c0)= { { c1 } })

blocks.name: 1loopgrvd2
blocks.content: The vertex degree of a one-edge graph, case 4: an edge from a vertex to itself contributes two to the vertex's degree. I. e. in a graph (simple pseudograph) with one edge which is a loop, the vertex connected with itself by the loop has degree 2. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 21-Feb-2021.)

} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)= 0), (w0 ‚Üí c5 ‚àà c2))

  fvsng(c3, c4, { c5 }, universe)
  bitrd(w0, ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0)), c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0)), c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` c3), ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà { c3 }, c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` hs0)))
  rexeqbidv(hs0, dom((iEdg ` c0)), { c3 }, w0, c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0), c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` hs0))
  eqtrd(dom((iEdg ` c0)), { c3 }, dom({ < c3, { c5 } > }), w0)

  snex(c5)

  fveq1d((iEdg ` c0), hs0, { < c3, { c5 } > }, w0)
  syl(w0, (‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà { c3 }, c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` hs0))‚Üî c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` c3)), c3 ‚àà c4)
  rexsng(hs0, c3, c4, c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` hs0), c1 ‚àà({ < c3, { c5 } > } ` c3))

  mpbird(w0, c1 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0), c1 ‚àà c2)

blocks.content: The vertex degree of vertex ` D ` in a graph ` G ` with only one hyperedge ` E ` is 0 if ` D ` is not incident with the edge ` E ` . (Contributed by AV, 2-Mar-2021.)

thm 1hevtxdg0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0))

} = {
  mpbird(w0, wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0), wn(wrex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))))

  neleqtrrd(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), c2), c3, w0)
  sylib(w0, wn(wcel(c1, c3)), wnel(c1, c3))
  df-nel(c1, c3)

  ralsng(hs0, c2, c5, wn(wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)))), wn(wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), c2))))
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), c2)))
  eleq2d(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)), cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), c2), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c2, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  raleqdv(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), csn(c2), w0, wn(wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)))))
  eqtrd(cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), csn(c2), cdm(csn(cop(c2, c3))), w0)
  dmeqd(cfv(ciedg, c0), csn(cop(c2, c3)), w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(cdm(csn(cop(c2, c3))), csn(c2)), wcel(c3, c6))
  dmsnopg(c3, c6, c2)
  ralnex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0))))
  syl(w0, wb(wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), nat0), wn(wrex(hs0, cdm(cfv(ciedg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(ciedg, c0), cv(hs0)))))), wcel(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0)))

thm 1hevtxdg0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

} = {

  fvsng(c2, c5, c3, c6)
  syl(w0, (‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà { c2 }, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0))‚Üî ¬¨ c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` c2)), c2 ‚àà c5)
  ralsng(hs0, c2, c5, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0), ¬¨ c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` c2))

  eleq2d(c1, ((iEdg ` c0)` hs0), ((iEdg ` c0)` c2), hs0 = c2)

  raleqdv(hs0, dom((iEdg ` c0)), { c2 }, w0, ¬¨ c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0))
  eqtrd(dom((iEdg ` c0)), { c2 }, dom({ < c2, c3 > }), w0)
  dmeqd((iEdg ` c0), { < c2, c3 > }, w0)
  syl(w0, dom({ < c2, c3 > })= { c2 }, c3 ‚àà c6)
  dmsnopg(c3, c6, c2)
  ralnex(hs0, dom((iEdg ` c0)), c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0))
  syl(w0, (((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1)= 0 ‚Üî ¬¨ ‚àÉ(hs0 ‚àà dom((iEdg ` c0)), c1 ‚àà((iEdg ` c0)` hs0))), c1 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0))
  mpbird(w0, c1 ‚àà(Vtx ` c0), c1 ‚àà c4)

blocks.name: uspgrloopnb0
blocks.content: In a graph (simple pseudograph) with one edge which is a loop (see ~ uspgr1v1eop ), the vertex connected with itself by the loop has no neighbors. (Contributed by AV, 17-Dec-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 21-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: uspgrloopvd2
blocks.content: The vertex degree of a one-edge graph, case 4: an edge from a vertex to itself contributes two to the vertex's degree. I. e. in a graph (simple pseudograph) with one edge which is a loop (see ~ uspgr1v1eop ), the vertex connected with itself by the loop has degree 2. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Alexander van der Vekens, 22-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 17-Dec-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 21-Feb-2021.)

blocks.name: hashnbusgrvd
blocks.content: In a simple graph, the number of neighbors of a vertex is the degree of this vertex. This theorem does not hold for (simple) pseudographs, because a vertex connected with itself only by a loop has no neighbors, see ~ uspgrloopnb0 , but degree 2, see ~ uspgrloopvd2 . And it does not hold for multigraphs, because a vertex connected with only one other vertex by two edges has one neighbor, see ~ umgr2v2enb1 , but also degree 2, see ~ umgr2v2evd2 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-May-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm hashnbusgrvd(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(cfv(chash, co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
} = {
  eqtr4d(cfv(chash, co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), cfv(chash, crab(hs0, cfv(cedg, c0), wcel(c1, cv(hs0)))), wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2)))
  nbedgusgr(hs0, c0, c1, c2, cfv(cedg, c0))
  vtxdusgrfvedg(hs0, c0, c1, c2, cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cfv(cedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cedg, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cedg, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
}

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà USGraph ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí(# `(c0[NeighbVtx]c1))=((VtxDeg ` c0)` c1))
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Vtx ` c0)
} = {

  nbedgusgr(hs0, c0, c1, c2, (Edg ` c0))
  vtxdusgrfvedg(hs0, c0, c1, c2, (VtxDeg ` c0), (Edg ` c0))
  eqid((Edg ` c0))
  eqid((VtxDeg ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((Edg ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)

blocks.name: usgruvtxvdb
blocks.content: In a finite simple graph with n vertices a vertex is universal iff the vertex has degree ` n - 1 ` . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 14-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 17-Dec-2020.)

  sssseq(cfv(cuvtx, c0), c1)
  eqcom(cfv(cuvtx, c0), c1)
  dfss3(s0, c1, cfv(cuvtx, c0))
  ralbidva(s0, c1, wcel(c0, cfusgr), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cuvtx, c0)), wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), cv(s0)), co(cfv(chash, c1), cmin, nat1)))

blocks.name: vtxdusgradjvtx
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex in a simple graph is the number of vertices adjacent to this vertex. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 9-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 23-Dec-2020.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cedg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  eqtr3d(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c0), c1), cfv(chash, crab(s0, c2, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c3))), cfv(chash, co(c0, cnbgr, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2)))
  hashnbusgrvd(c0, c1, c2)
  fveq2d(chash, co(c0, cnbgr, c1), crab(s0, c2, wcel(cpr(c1, cv(s0)), c3)), wa(wcel(c0, cusgr), wcel(c1, c2)))

}

blocks.name: usgrvd00
blocks.content: If every vertex in a simple graph has degree 0, there is no edge in the graph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 12-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 17-Dec-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Dec-2020.)

blocks.name: vdegp1ai
blocks.content: The induction step for a vertex degree calculation. If the degree of ` U ` in the edge set ` E ` is ` P ` , then adding ` { X , Y } ` to the edge set, where ` X =/= U =/= Y ` , yields degree ` P ` as well. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2016.) (Revised by AV, 3-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: vdegp1bi
blocks.content: The induction step for a vertex degree calculation, for example in the Königsberg graph. If the degree of ` U ` in the edge set ` E ` is ` P ` , then adding ` { U , X } ` to the edge set, where ` X =/= U ` , yields degree ` P + 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2016.) (Revised by AV, 3-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: vdegp1ci
blocks.content: The induction step for a vertex degree calculation, for example in the Königsberg graph. If the degree of ` U ` in the edge set ` E ` is ` P ` , then adding ` { X , U } ` to the edge set, where ` X =/= U ` , yields degree ` P + 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Mar-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2016.) (Revised by AV, 3-Mar-2021.)

  -| wcel(c5, cword(crab(s0, cdif(cpw(c3), csn(emptycls)), wbr(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), cle, nat2))))
  -| wceq(cfv(cfv(cvtxdg, c4), c1), c2)
  -| wceq(cfv(cvtx, c0), c3)
  -| wcel(c6, c3)
  -| wne(c6, c1)
  -| wceq(cfv(ciedg, c0), co(c5, cconcat, cs1(cpr(c6, c1))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
} = {

  eqtri(cfv(ciedg, c0), co(c5, cconcat, cs1(cpr(c1, c6))), co(c5, cconcat, cs1(cpr(c6, c1))))
  oveq2i(c5, cconcat, cs1(cpr(c6, c1)), cs1(cpr(c1, c6)))
  ax-mp(wceq(cs1(cpr(c6, c1)), cs1(cpr(c1, c6))), wceq(cpr(c6, c1), cpr(c1, c6)))
  prcom(c6, c1)

}

blocks.name: vtxdginducedm1
blocks.content: The degree of a vertex ` v ` in the induced subgraph ` S ` of a pseudograph ` G ` obtained by removing one vertex ` N ` plus the number of edges joining the vertex ` v ` and the vertex ` N ` is the degree of the vertex ` v ` in the pseudograph ` G ` . (Contributed by AV, 17-Dec-2021.)

(Contributed by AV, 18-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: finsumvtxdg2sstep
blocks.content: Induction step of ~ finsumvtxdg2size : In a finite pseudograph of finite size, the sum of the degrees of all vertices of the pseudograph is twice the size of the pseudograph if the sum of the degrees of all vertices of the subgraph of the pseudograph not containing one of the vertices is twice the size of the subgraph. (Contributed by AV, 19-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: finsumvtxdg2size
blocks.content: The sum of the degrees of all vertices of a finite pseudograph of finite size is twice the size of the pseudograph. See equation (1) in section I.1 in [Bollobas] p. 4. Here, the "proof" is simply the statement "Since each edge has two endvertices, the sum of the degrees is exactly twice the number of edges". The formal proof of this theorem (for pseudographs) is much more complicated, taking also the used auxiliary theorems into account. The proof for a (finite) simple graph (see ~ fusgr1th ) would be shorter, but nevertheless still laborious. Although this theorem would hold also for infinite pseudographs and pseudographs of infinite size, the proof of this most general version (see theorem "sumvtxdg2size" below) would require many more auxiliary theorems (e.g., the extension of the sum ` sum_ ` over an arbitrary set). I dedicate this theorem and its proof to Norman Megill, who deceased too early on December 9, 2021. This proof is an example for the rigor which was the main motivation for Norman Megill to invent and develop Metamath, see section 1.1.6 "Rigor" on page 19 of the Metamath book: "... it is usually assumed in mathematical literature that the person reading the proof is a mathematician familiar with the specialty being described, and that the missing steps are obvious to such a reader or at least the reader is capable of filling them in." I filled in the missing steps of Bollobas' proof as Norm would have liked it... (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: fusgr1th
blocks.content: The sum of the degrees of all vertices of a finite simple graph is twice the size of the graph. See equation (1) in section I.1 in [Bollobas] p. 4. Also known as the "First Theorem of Graph Theory" (see ~ https://charlesreid1.com/wiki/First_Theorem_of_Graph_Theory ). (Contributed by AV, 26-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: finsumvtxdgeven
blocks.content: The sum of the degrees of all vertices of a finite pseudograph of finite size is even. See equation (2) in section I.1 in [Bollobas] p. 4, where it is also called the _handshaking lemma_. (Contributed by AV, 22-Dec-2021.)

  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {

  hashcl(c2)

  2teven(cfv(chash, c2), co(nat2, cmul, cfv(chash, c2)))

blocks.name: fusgrvtxdgonume
blocks.content: The number of vertices of odd degree is even in a finite simple graph. Proposition 1.2.1 in [Diestel] p. 5. See also remark about equation (2) in section I.1 in [Bollobas] p. 4. (Contributed by AV, 27-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm fusgrvtxdgonume(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cvtx, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ciedg, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cvtxdg, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, cfusgr), wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(chash, crab(s0, c1, wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, cfv(c2, cv(s0))))))), w3a(wcel(c0, cupgr), wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c3, cfn)))
  fusgrfupgrfs(c0, c1, c3)
  vtxdgoddnumeven(s0, c0, c1, c3, c2)
}
